Name: Cosmetic palette in the shape of a fish
Description: This flat palette shows the silhouette of a tilapia fish. On both sides, the head is divided from the body by a curved carved line, the dorsal and pelvic fins are indicated by notches. In the middle of the dorsal fin is a hole for a string for suspension. On palettes such as these, mineral paints, used primarily to decorate the body, were ground to powder. It is possible that they were also worn as amulets.
